questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, known for its twin skyscrapers and completed in 1998, held the title of the tallest buildings in the world until 2004?
questions.context: These iconic towers in Malaysia feature a skybridge on the 41st and 42nd floors and were designed by Argentine architect CÃ©sar Pelli.

questions.question: Which historical battle site, significant in 1066, changed the course of English history by leading to the Norman conquest?
questions.context: The Battle of Hastings took place here, where William the Conqueror defeated King Harold II. The abbey was subsequently built as a memorial.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin, featuring the Temple of Athena Nike, was a central structure in the development of ancient Greek culture?
questions.context: The Acropolis is an ancient citadel that hosted buildings of great architectural and historic significance, including the Parthenon.

questions.question: Which famous museum, located in the heart of France, houses the renowned painting 'Mona Lisa'?
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, it is now the world's largest art museum and a historic monument visited by millions annually.

questions.question: Which capital city is home to the iconic Eiffel Tower, a structure built for the 1889 World's Fair to mark the centennial of the French Revolution?
questions.context: The Eiffel Tower has become a global cultural icon of France and is one of the most recognizable structures in the world, attracting millions of visitors each year.
